conclusion: Acceleration at any instant is the slope of the v-t curve at that instant.
The curve for object B is U-shaped (concave upward).
The slope starts out negative at t = 0.
The slope steadily becomes less negative.
The slope reaches zero at the very bottom of the U (minimum velocity, around t₁).
The slope turns positive and keeps getting steeper until t₂.
From t = 0 to t₂, the acceleration of object B always increases.
Acceleration begins with a negative value, rises continuously through zero, and ends with a positive value of greater magnitude at t₂.
